hints_html:
First, write the series in terms of summation notation.

Try the p-series test with the comparison test.
hints_latex: First, write the series in terms of summation notation.
Try the p-series test with the comparison test.
hints_raw:
First, write the series in terms of summation notation.
Try the p-series test with the comparison test.
question: 9 (a)
sols_html:
This is the series

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle \sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{1}{2n-1}\end{aligned}\]

Notice

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle \frac{1}{2n-1} > \frac{1}{2n} > 0\end{aligned}\]

for all \(\displaystyle n\), and

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle \sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{1}{2n} = \frac{1}{2} \sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{1}{n}\end{aligned}\]

diverges by p-series (it’s just a multiple of the harmonic series). Then by the comparison test, the series

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle 1+\frac{1}{3}+\frac{1}{5}+\frac{1}{7}+\frac{1}{9}+\cdots\end{aligned}\]

diverges.
sols_raw:
This is the series 

:<math> 
\displaystyle 
\sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{1}{2n-1}
</math>

Notice

:<math> 
\displaystyle 
\frac{1}{2n-1} > \frac{1}{2n} > 0
</math>

for all <math> \displaystyle n</math>, and 

:<math> 
\displaystyle 
\sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{1}{2n} = \frac{1}{2} \sum_{n=1}^\infty \frac{1}{n}
</math>

diverges by p-series (it's just a multiple of the harmonic series). Then by the comparison test, the series

:<math> 
\displaystyle 
1+\frac{1}{3}+\frac{1}{5}+\frac{1}{7}+\frac{1}{9}+\cdots
</math>

diverges.
